meanings.definition: To enclose or surround in a sphere.
meanings.sent1: The magician was ensphering the rabbit in a glass ball.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys ensphering her thoughts in a journal every night.
meanings.sent3: The artist tried ensphering the paintbrush in a soap bubble for fun.
meanings.sent4: The mist ensphered the mountaintop, creating a mystical aura.
meanings.sent5: The spider ensphered its prey in a delicate web.

meanings.definition: To place in or as if in a sphere.
meanings.sent1: The children were ensphering their toys in a toy chest.
meanings.sent2: He carefully ensphered the fragile glass ornament in bubble wrap.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully ensphered the cherry on top of the cake.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight ensphered the garden, casting a soft glow.
meanings.sent5: The scientist ensphered the specimen in a protective casing.

meanings.sent1: The potter was ensphering the clay into a perfect round shape.
meanings.sent2: The snowball fight ensphered the park in laughter and joy.
meanings.sent3: The children were ensphering the sand into a giant ball at the beach.
meanings.sent4: The artist ensphered the wire into a beautiful spherical sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The baker ensphered the dough into small, round cookies.
